virtual ~MidiSound ()

Detailed Description

Obsolete - all sound classes from AddOns/MultiMedia have been replaced by a new audio concept. Use the AudioDeviceManager instead for playing sounds.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

ID 

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MidiSound::MidiSound (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

MidiSound::MidiSound (  BinData *  bin_data  )  [explicit]
 

Initializes an MIDI sound with the given bin_data.

Parameters:
bin_data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the i-melody data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the MIDI sound and hence automatically released in the destructor of the MIDI sound.

MidiSound::~MidiSound (   )  [virtual]

Initializes an MIDI sound with the given bin_data.

Parameters:
bin_data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the i-melody data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the MIDI sound and hence automatically released in the destructor of the MIDI sound.
